p: Essential oils, which are complex mixtures of volatile components such as monoterpenoids and sesquiterpenoids (Pavela and Benelli 2016), can represent a new strategy to combat several parasites including L3 larvae of A. simplex (Giarratana et al. 2014; Hierro et al. 2004; Romero et al. 2012). In this regard, Origanum essential oils have been shown to possess in vivo efficacy against larvae of Anisakis (PÃ©rez et al. 2016; Abattouy et al. 2010). On this basis, we focused our attention on the essential oil obtained from Origanum compactum Benth., belonging to the Lamiaceae family.
